alert.note: Alert for Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Hydrologic Outlook issued August 01 at 4:05PM EDT by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...Heavy Rains Will Offer Flash Flood Potential... Multiple rounds of thunderstorms are forecast over portions of the Quad State region through the mid week. These rounds of storms will be primarily night-time rounds and will include heavy rain potential. Over time, there might be enough heavy rain to repeat over the same areas to heighten flood potential. The first round of potential heavy rain comes later tonight and early Wednesday morning. It will be focused primarily over the Ozarks of southeast Missouri, where it has been much drier lately. The NWS will closely monitor this area, as well as areas upstream, to the north and west, where heavier rains will be more widespread, and any downstream flow that might help fill our creeks and streams quicker. The second main round of storms is the better round of more active and widespread heavy rain potential. It will come Wednesday night and may extend into Thursday morning, as storms spread east of the Mississippi River. Grounds east of the Mississippi have received more generous rainfall lately, so the overall wetter conditions may flood more readily should repeat heavy rains occur Wednesday night into Thursday. Flash Flood Watches and Warnings could become necessary with time. Be mindful that areas which experienced historic flooding recently may still have debris, trees, and brush lodged in creeks and streams. This lingering storm debris can act as a clog that backs up the overall drainage system and causes water to rise faster than it normally would. Citizens and communities are encouraged to clear their storm drainage systems ahead of the arrival of these anticipated rains, and maintain awareness of the potential threats and check back for updates.

area.areaDesc: Gibson; Pike; Posey; Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick
